fields.summary: Dashboard "In Scaling Groups" count never resolves

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I have the following launch config,
{noformat}
# euscale-describe-launch-configs
LAUNCH-CONFIG	MyLaunchConfig	emi-A9723AE4	m1.small
{noformat}

But it doesn't show in the eucalyptus-console.

Also, it fails when a new LC is created from Launch Config page (screenshot1 attached)
fields.summary: Cannot create/view launch config in Launch Config landing page
fields.environment:
Name        : eucalyptus-console
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.2763.20130925gitb82486cd.el6
Size        : 4.7 M
Repo        : installed
From repo   : eucalyptus-console

comments.body: Could you say more about the user and IAM policy in place? Are other resources showing up? Are you able to create a launch config in the console, but just not view it?
yes, that's correct, I can create LC from cli, but cannot view or create from user console. I am using admin user of an account.

[~dkavanagh] Resources except Autoscaling group count are showing up on Dashboard and Landing pages correctly. 
ASG count on Dashboard does not resolve, there was an ticket created earlier:  EUCA-7633 describing it.
[~dkavanagh] - I remember you were working on some kind of autoscaling policy problem recently with [~viglesias]. Could it be that?

Huh... now I see the same error in the proxy log. What's interesting is that other components are unaffected:

app.data.tags.fetch()
...ok
app.data.launchConfigs.fetch()
POST http://euca-jerry.brainfood.com/autoscaling?Action=DescribeLaunchConfigurations 403 (Forbidden) jquery-1.8.2.js:8416
app.data.scalingGroup.fetch()
...ok
app.data.images.fetch()
...ok

trace:

2013-09-26 23:18:15 INFO received boto server error (403,Forbidden,Invalid access key or token)
2013-09-26 23:18:15 WARNING 403 POST /autoscaling?Action=DescribeLaunchConfigurations (::1) 210.60ms
2013-09-26 23:18:24 INFO problem with cache get call!
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jpommer/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/cache.py", line 246, in __cache_load_callback__
    err = ex.error
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto-2.9.6-py2.6.egg/boto/exception.py", line 101, in __getattr__
    raise AttributeError
I just successfully created an LC in the console with the latest console code pulled from testing.

[~jloza],

That's true, I could create LC with the packages from yesterday as well. Not sure, if there was any fix went in or this just happened with that particular package.

So after letting the console sit idle for an hour, I didn't get the session expiration notice popup, I don't see the expiration push log message, and the proxy log is repeating this:

AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute '__dict__'
2013-10-04 13:28:02 INFO CACHE: error calling get_all_launch_configurations(403,Forbidden,Invalid access key or token)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jpommer/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/cache.py", line 177, in values
    item_dict = item.__dict__
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute '__dict__'

So, something is expiring/timing out and not telling us.
[~kgill] - I suspect that your fix to EUCA-7019 will solve this one too.
Submitting to QA, per [~jpommer]'s comment that the fix for EUCA-7019 (merged into testing almost an hour ago) will likely fix this issue.

Verified. Was able to create LC from console.

Installed Packages
{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus-console
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.2790.20131007git0d711f9f.el6
Size        : 4.7 M
Repo        : installed
{noformat}
